entries.meaning: (mining, historical) A worker who gets coal off at a longwall face.
(wrestling) One who uses the cross-buttock throw.
examples: It is a chip, however, always fraught with peril, as the slack hold of the buttocker, if he misses his aim, enables his opponent to gain a firmer grip, which he is certain to make the best use of in the commanding position in which he finds himself.
